intro: Toelkenia arborescens, commonly known as the tree spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Toelkenia arborescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It contains toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation and should be handled with care.
